intro: Cyclocampe waigiouensis, commonly known as the Waigiouensis cyclocampe, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically white or pale purple. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
